subject: Public Speaking
title: Voice Tremor and Vocal Cord Tension
description: A 60-second lesson on Voice Tremor and Vocal Cord Tension.

hook.text: Your voice cracks mid-sentence. You sound like a teenager again. The audience notices, and you panic more.

buildup.text: Stress tightens the muscles around your vocal cords, raising your pitch and making your voice thin and shaky.

discovery.text: Adrenaline also speeds breathing, pushing air through tight cords too fast. The result: tremor and squeaking.

twist.text: Professional singers get the same tension. They manage it with warm-ups, not willpower. Speaking is a physical act.

climax.text: Voice tremor is purely mechanicalâ€”tight muscles plus fast air. Understanding this removes its psychological power.

punchline.text: Your voice cracks because your throat is bracing for impact.

quiz.question: What causes voice tremor during public speaking?
options: Stress tightening muscles around vocal cords plus fast breathing
